Articles.Content: Yeah, but the flightGlobalsIndex numbers need to be changed to work right?

Not anymore, just put in any random ID for the flightGlobalsIndex.

Also, check the spreadsheet. Some updates are present.

Awesome idea for the Alfons, but how are we going to make them procedural?

Also, will they have gravity, or will they be like the asteroids for ARM missions?

Procedural, as in generated with a certain seed. Procedural generation is what most of the stock planets use, so yes, they will have gravity, and I have a working Alfons in my test instance of KSP, tring to correct the terrain as we speak.

I'll provide the config in about 20-30 minutes, once I clean it up a bit.

Awesome!

I thought it was going to be like those ARM asteroids that you have to rendezvous with (that would be a nice idea - give ARM asteroid random colors when they spawn).

I should really notice the procedural terrain stuff.
Heres the CFG file for Procedural generation: Pastebin
Speaking of progress...

Hey Amarius! I got a present for you, you'll need to do the adjustments though. Oceans work.

Tyrok CFG

Great news!!!

EDIT: I made a quick test of the new Tyrok, and It finally works, but... Maybe it's part of the adjustement, but I share: The biomes are from laythe (for now who cares?), from Prbit the planets is really good looking, but there is something weird with the atmosphere, you start from vacuum to Full Atmospheric Pressure in just a moment. It gives some weird data to KER too. When you try to land on Tyrok, the terrain disappear from 7/5 km from ground. Here's some screenshot for everyone:

BTW, from orbit Tyrok is really beautiful. With some clouds, it will be one of the most awesome planets on the Kerbol System, challenging Tekto.

Yea, as for the problems with the surface and everything, I'll have to leave that to Amarius. I did my job of getting it to load, since I don't know what exactly need to be fixed, that should be his job...

Hope he's happy it works.

I don't deserve the title of spellchecker, what I missed was obvious...

It's also not supposed to look like that from orbit... Check this spreadsheet for info on our plans for the pack: Spreadsheet

QUESTION: I haven't tested Tyrok yet, do you fall thru the planet and explode? Applying Laythe as a template can do that...

Edited June 19, 2015 by Hammersamatom
Yes, I did. But think that the KER was giving me 0.00 TWR and 0.000 Thrust. I impacted the ground (supposed) at 75 m/s. I think it's has to do with the needed configuration for the planet.
I think it has to do with the normal mapping... Not much can be done, let Amarius handle it.

Coming late to the party, but I just want to share that I'm a sucker for alternate star systems, instead of adding planets to Kerbol. So I would love all these crazy planets around another star. Maybe the aliens who came from that star became Type II and started making ridiculous, planet-scale art projects, before ascending to another form of existence. I think it would explain your awesome weird stuff like cube moons and be a cool theme for sciency easter eggs.

Edited June 20, 2015 by beabop

@Beabop, nice suggestion, but we're probably going to keep the current planets where they are for now.

However, if we did add more star systems...

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I'd definitely want to be involved.

Edited June 20, 2015 by Hammersamatom

As long as you're not changing the sun, I thought making an alternate star system is just a matter of an alternate Kopernicus config? AFAIK, the hard part (and the part that makes me want an "official" version) is balancing their orbits to be fun and challenging.

I think that we will probably implement stars soon, but they will be extremely far from Kerbol/Sun and will contain separate planet systems.

We may add different star systems with planets based on actual discoveries.

However, despite breaking the laws of stellar mechanics, we will make all the star orbit Kerbol/Sun, just for the sake of not moving stuff and making craft disappear (that happened a while ago, and I don't think the bug's fixed).
